title: [StatusChatInput] Undo hotkeys does not undo text formatting (bold/italic/etc)
body:
# Bug Report

## Description

If I select any text and want to make it bold/italic etc, and then decide to undo these changes, the left special symbol is not removed (need to undo twice)

## Steps to reproduce

1. Input any text
2. Select some word and make it bold/italic etc
3. Undo changes

<!-- example: step 1. do X step 2. do Y etc.. -->

#### Expected behavior

Bold/italic formatting is removed

#### Actual behavior

The special symbol from the left is not removed. Need to undo it twice

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.8.1
- Operating System: macos

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117639195/207888369-032c466d-9aeb-4544-a54f-ea0b6f7cdfe7.mov

Here's what I found out so far:

# The problem

The culprit is that we can't do the word substitution (wrapping in **) in a single step, _atomically_. The current solution does:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/7d0d321b35e60f2c70c70d36ee32efc070bf2f40/ui/imports/shared/status/StatusChatInput.qml#L526-L527

Which in turn does `messageInputField.insert()` twice, for the prefix ** and the postfix **. This is registered as two edits by the `QTextEdit` undo history, thus when undo-ing via the `âŒ˜+Z`, the need to press twice to undo what we perceive as a single action (pressing `âŒ˜+B`).

# The solution?

In short, I couldn't find a workaround that behaves better than the current situation. Here's what I tried:

## Disabling the Undo history for a moment

There's no API for this. Trying to _disable_ the Undo tree, for the duration of the two step edit, via alternative means like `Control.enabled = false` or setting `readOnly` to true, does nothing or results in text artifacts.	 

```qml
     messageInputField.readOnly = true
     insertInTextInput(messageInputField.selectionStart, wrapWith);
     insertInTextInput(messageInputField.selectionEnd, wrapWith);
     messageInputField.readOnly = false
```

## Remove, then insert

This is the same behavior as the current implementation, only that instead of undoing each ** pair in turn, first `âŒ˜+Z` press will undo the entire `**word**`, leaving _blank_ in instead and second press bring back `word` (without the wrapping **). I don't think it's better than the current implementation behavior (undoing each ** pair in turn).

```qml
       let selStart = messageInputField.selectionStart
       let word = messageInputField.selectedText
       messageInputField.remove(messageInputField.selectionStart, messageInputField.selectionEnd);
       messageInputField.insert(selStart, wrapWith + word + wrapWith);
       messageInputField.select(newSelectionStart, newSelectionEnd)
```

## Overwriting the entire text document

The last obvious thing to try, is to completely replace `TextEdit.text` with a version that has the substitution done outside the QML control interface.

```qml
        var unformattedText = messageInputField.getText(0, messageInputField.length)
        let word = messageInputField.selectedText
        var left = unformattedText.substring(0, messageInputField.selectionStart)
        var right = unformattedText.substring(messageInputField.selectionEnd, messageInputField.text.length)
        messageInputField.text = left + wrapWith + word +  wrapWith + right
        messageInputField.select(newSelectionStart, newSelectionEnd)
```

Unfortunately, assigning to `TextEdit.text` clears the entire Undo tree thus far, so history is not available anymore, pressing `âŒ˜+Z` results in nothing.

# The conclusion

As I'm out of ideas to try around the limitation of the API (not being able to do this prefix/postfix substitution in a fell swoop), I'll put this on hold until I or somebody else comes with suggestions. Maybe @alexandraB99 can pitch in here or advertise this to extra ðŸ‘€ .
